definition: to mix/to mix in/to toss (a salad)
and/together with/with/sum/union/peace/harmony/Taiwan pr. [han4] when it means "and" or "with"
to combine a powdery substance (flour, plaster etc) with water/Taiwan pr. [huo4]
to complete a set in mahjong or playing cards
to compose a poem in reply (to sb's poem) using the same rhyme sequence/to join in the singing/to chime in with others
to mix (ingredients) together/to blend/classifier for rinses of clothes/classifier for boilings of medicinal herbs

sentences.english: Add two cups of sifted flour to one cup of sugar and mix.
sentences.chinese: 把兩杯篩過的麪粉加一杯糖後拌和。

sentences.english: You would throw the rice in and mix it up.
sentences.chinese: 你會把米扔進去並把它拌和。

sentences.english: Then the experiments of measuring mixing index for concrete were conducted for its verification.
sentences.chinese: 通過驗證實驗證明了拌和指數的可行性。

sentences.english: The conclusion derived is suitable to all centrally located stabilized soil mixer.
sentences.chinese: 所得結論適用於所有中置式穩定土拌和機。

sentences.english: It is the complicated dynamic rheology course to mix and stir the course in vibration.
sentences.chinese: 振動拌和過程是複雜的動態流變過程。

sentences.english: The core links of the construction of the cement concrete road surface are the mixing and spreading of concrete.
sentences.chinese: 水泥混土路面施工的核心環節是混凝土的拌和與攤鋪。

sentences.english: Weight drop scale has been widely used in stabilized soil mixing plant.
sentences.chinese: 減量秤在穩定土拌和站水泥供給系統中有廣泛的應用。

sentences.english: The time opposes to this turning point is the initial setting time.
sentences.chinese: 該轉折點對應的時間爲碾壓混凝土拌和物的初凝時間。

definition: to mix/to mix in/to toss (a salad)
cooking starch/pasty mixture of starch and water
to mash/to beat to a pulp
